Bills Are Paid Late, 'A Week Later They're Due Again,' Says Caller Earning $75K — Dave Ramsey Snaps, 'I Don't Give A Crap, Go Eat Leftovers'
summary: Paying the bills never seems to move the needle for one couple, no matter how carefully they budget. Janet, from Boise, Idaho, called "The Ramsey Show," saying that despite trying to plan ahead, she and her husband feel trapped in a cycle where bills come due again almost immediately after they are paid. headline: 'We Would Likely See A Significant Contraction,' SoFi CEO Anthony Noto Says Of Trump's 10% Cap Plan — Consumers 'Will Still Need Access To Credit'
summary: A policy meant to make borrowing cheaper could end up changing who gets access to credit at all. That is the likely outcome of a proposed 10% cap on credit card interest rates, according to SoFi Technologies (NASDAQ:SOFI) CEO Anthony Noto. In a recent post on X, Noto responded to President Donald Trump's proposal, saying the immediate effect would likely be a contraction in credit card lending rather than a drop in consumer demand for borrowing. summary: Earnings from some of the world’s biggest technology companies this week will offer an indication of whether they should stick to that strategy in 2026.
